Package oh_hecc.mvc.model_bits

Class ModelButtonObject

java.lang.Object
oh_hecc.mvc.model_bits.AbstractObject
oh_hecc.mvc.model_bits.EditModelObject
oh_hecc.mvc.model_bits.ModelButtonObject
public class ModelButtonObject
extends EditModelObject
This class basically represents the buttons that will appear across the bottom of the model, allowing the user to do things like access the metadata editing window, add a new passage, save their work, save+quit, etc.

Y'know, the boring bits.

  • Constructor Details

    • ModelButtonObject

      public ModelButtonObject​(EditModelInterface model, float relativeLeft, float relativeRight, java.lang.String text)
      The constructor for the ModelButtonObject
      Parameters:
      model - the PassageModel that this object refers to
      relativeLeft - 0-1. 0: the left side of this button will be at the far left of viewport. 1: left side of button at far right of viewport
      relativeRight - 0-1. 0: the right side of this button will be at the far left of viewport. 1: right side of button at far right of viewport
      text - text for the button

      public boolean wasClicked​(java.awt.Point clickLocation)
      Description copied from class: AbstractObject
      Check whether or not this object's areaRectangle contains the clickLocation point
      Overrides:

      Returns:
      true if areaRectangle contains clickLocation

    • resize

      public void resize​(int w, int h)
      Model should call this for all buttons when it's resized, so the buttons will remain the same size (relative to the viewable model itself) and at the the bottom of the model
      Parameters:
      w - new width of the model
      h - new height of the model
